page.title: 05FARMING-N CREAKE
page.content: Farming is the main industry of this area. Most of the land is owned by Earl Spencer's estate and is let to tenant farmers in one large unit and several small-holdings. One farm of about 500 acres is privately owned, as is one small-holding. this is a prime sugar-beet growing area with the processing factory 22 miles away at Kings Lynn. The climate is conducive to the production of good malting barley. Wheat, oats & oilseed rape are grown, some rye grass for seed production, and mustard on contract for a national company. Carrots and other vegetables provide useful break-crops. There are no livestock farmers in this area. The farmers are generally sympathetic to the need for countryside conservation.
